intro: Schizolegnia stortii, commonly known as the Stortii's spurge, is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family. It is a perennial herbaceous plant characterized by its succulent, fleshy stems and leaves. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to dry conditions. Its flowers are small and clustered, often surrounded by specialized structures called cyathia. Schizolegnia stortii is known for its ability to store water in its tissues, a feature that aids in its survival in harsh climates.
